00001 /**
00002  * \file RandomAlgorithm.hpp
00003  * \brief Header for MT19937 and SFMT19937.
00004  *
00005  * This provides an interface to the Mersenne Twister
00006  * <a href="http://www.math.sci.hiroshima-u.ac.jp/~m-mat/MT/emt.html">
00007  * MT19937</a> and SIMD oriented Fast Mersenne Twister
00008  * <a href="http://www.math.sci.hiroshima-u.ac.jp/~m-mat/MT/SFMT/index.html">
00009  * SFMT19937</a> random number engines.
00010  *
00011  * Interface routines written by Charles Karney <charles@karney.com> and
00012  * licensed under the MIT/X11 License.  For more information, see
00013  * http://randomlib.sourceforge.net/
00014  **********************************************************************/
00015 
00016 #if !defined(RANDOMLIB_RANDOMALGORITHM_HPP)
00017 #define RANDOMLIB_RANDOMALGORITHM_HPP \
00018   "$Id: 9b552f2d80c03c7729eff07431a92a6c51211767 $"
00019 
00020 #include <RandomLib/RandomType.hpp>
00021 #include <stdexcept>
00022 #include <string>
00023 #if defined(HAVE_SSE2) && HAVE_SSE2
00024 #include <emmintrin.h>

00031 namespace RandomLib {
00032 
00033   /**
00034    * \brief The %MT19937 random number engine.
00035    *
00036    * This provides an interface to Mersenne Twister random number engine,
00037    * <a href="http://www.math.sci.hiroshima-u.ac.jp/~m-mat/MT/emt.html">
00038    * MT19937</a>.  See\n Makoto Matsumoto and Takuji Nishimura,\n Mersenne
00039    * Twister: A 623-Dimensionally Equidistributed Uniform Pseudo-Random Number
00040    * Generator,\n ACM TOMACS 8, 3-30 (1998)
00041    *
00042    * This is adapted from the 32-bit and 64-bit C versions available at
00043    * http://www.math.sci.hiroshima-u.ac.jp/~m-mat/MT/MT2002/emt19937ar.html and
00044    * http://www.math.sci.hiroshima-u.ac.jp/~m-mat/MT/emt64.html
00045    *
00046    * The template argument give the type \e RandomType of the "natural" result.
00047    * This incorporates the bit width and the C++ type of the result.  Although
00048    * the two versions of MT19937 produce different sequences, the
00049    * implementations here are portable across 32-bit and 64-bit architectures.
00050    *
00051    * The class chiefly supplies the method for advancing the state by
00052    * Transition.
00053    *
00054    * @tparam RandomType the type of the results, either Random_u32 or
00055    *   Random_u64.
00056    *
00057    * Interface routines written by Charles Karney <charles@karney.com> and
00058    * licensed under the MIT/X11 License.  For more information, see
00059    * http://randomlib.sourceforge.net/
00060    **********************************************************************/
00061   template<class RandomType> class RANDOM_EXPORT MT19937 {
00062   public:
00063     /**
00064      * The result RandomType
00065      **********************************************************************/
00066     typedef RandomType engine_t;
00067     /**
00068      * The internal numeric type for MT19337::Transition
00069      **********************************************************************/
00070     typedef typename engine_t::type internal_type;
00071   private:
00072     /**
00073      * The unsigned type of engine_t
00074      **********************************************************************/
00075     typedef typename engine_t::type engine_type;
00076     /**
00077      * The width of the engine_t
00078      **********************************************************************/
00079     static const unsigned width = engine_t::width;
00080     enum {
00081       /**
00082        * The Mersenne prime is 2<sup><i>P</i></sup> - 1
00083        **********************************************************************/
00084       P = 19937,
00085       /**
00086        * The short lag for MT19937
00087        **********************************************************************/
00088       M = width == 32 ? 397 : 156,
00089       /**
00090        * The number of ignored bits in the first word of the state
00091        **********************************************************************/
00092       R = ((P + width - 1)/width) * width - P
00093     };
00094     static const engine_type mask = engine_t::mask;
00095     /**
00096      * Magic matrix for MT19937
00097      **********************************************************************/
00098     static const engine_type magic =
00099       width == 32 ? 0x9908b0dfULL : 0xb5026f5aa96619e9ULL;
00100     /**
00101      * Mask for top \e width - \e R bits of a word
00102      **********************************************************************/
00103     static const engine_type upper = mask << R & mask;
00104     /**
00105      * Mask for low \e R bits of a <i>width</i>-bit word
00106      **********************************************************************/
00107     static const engine_type lower = ~upper & mask;
00108 
00109   public:
00110     /**
00111      * A version number "EnMT" or "EnMU" to ensure safety of Save/Load.  This
00112      * needs to be unique across RandomAlgorithms.
00113      **********************************************************************/
00114     static const unsigned version = 0x456e4d54UL + (engine_t::width/32 - 1);
00115     enum {
00116       /**
00117        * The size of the state.  This is the long lag for MT19937.
00118        **********************************************************************/
00119       N = (P + width - 1)/width
00120     };
00121     /**
00122      * Advance state by \e count batches.  For speed all \e N words of state
00123      * are advanced together.  If \e count is negative, the state is stepped
00124      * backwards.  This is the meat of the MT19937 engine.
00125      *
00126      * @param[in] count how many batches to advance.
00127      * @param[in,out] statev the internal state of the random number generator.
00128      **********************************************************************/
00129     static void Transition(long long count, internal_type statev[])
00130       throw();
00131 
00132     /**
00133      * Manipulate a word of the state prior to output.
00134      *
00135      * @param[in] y a word of the state.
00136      * @return the result.
00137      **********************************************************************/
00138     static engine_type Generate(engine_type y) throw();
00139 
00140     /**
00141      * Convert an arbitrary state into a legal one.  This consists of (a)
00142      * turning on one bit if the state is all zero and (b) making 31 bits of
00143      * the state consistent with the other 19937 bits.
00144      *
00145      * @param[in,out] state the state of the generator.
00146      **********************************************************************/
00147     static void NormalizeState(engine_type state[]) throw();
00148 
00149     /**
00150      * Check that the state is legal, throwing an exception if it is not.  At
00151      * the same time, accumulate a checksum of the state.
00152      *
00153      * @param[in] state the state of the generator.
00154      * @param[in,out] check an accumulated checksum.
00155      **********************************************************************/
00156     static void CheckState(const engine_type state[], Random_u32::type& check);
00157 
00158     /**
00159      * Return the name of the engine
00160      *
00161      * @return the name.
00162      **********************************************************************/
00163     static std::string Name() throw() {
00164       return "MT19937<Random_u" + std::string(width == 32 ? "32" : "64") + ">";
00165     }
00166   };
00167 
00168   /// \cond SKIP
00169   template<>
00170   inline Random_u32::type MT19937<Random_u32>::Generate(engine_type y) throw() {
00171     y ^= y >> 11;
00172     y ^= y <<  7 & engine_type(0x9d2c5680UL);
00173     y ^= y << 15 & engine_type(0xefc60000UL);
00174     y ^= y >> 18;
00175 
00176     return y;
00177   }
00178 
00179   template<>
00180   inline Random_u64::type MT19937<Random_u64>::Generate(engine_type y) throw() {
00181     // Specific tempering instantiation for width = 64 given in
00182     // http://www.math.sci.hiroshima-u.ac.jp/~m-mat/MT/emt64.html
00183     y ^= y >> 29 & engine_type(0x5555555555555555ULL);
00184     y ^= y << 17 & engine_type(0x71d67fffeda60000ULL);
00185     y ^= y << 37 & engine_type(0xfff7eee000000000ULL);
00186     y ^= y >> 43;
00187 
00188     return y;
00189   }
00190   /// \endcond
00191 
00192   /**
00193    * \brief The SFMT random number engine.
00194    *
00195    * This provides an implementation of the SIMD-oriented Fast Mersenne Twister
00196    * random number engine,
00197    * <a href="http://www.math.sci.hiroshima-u.ac.jp/~m-mat/MT/SFMT/index.html">
00198    * SFMT</a>.  See\n Mutsuo Saito,\n An Application of Finite Field: Design
00199    * and Implementation of 128-bit Instruction-Based Fast Pseudorandom Number
00200    * Generator,\n Master's Thesis, Dept. of Math., Hiroshima University
00201    * (Feb. 2007).\n
00202    * http://www.math.sci.hiroshima-u.ac.jp/~m-mat/MT/SFMT/M062821.pdf
00203    * Mutsuo Saito and Makoto Matsumoto,\n
00204    * SIMD-oriented Fast Mersenne Twister: a 128-bit Pseudorandom Number
00205    * Generator,\n accepted in the proceedings of MCQMC2006\n
00206    * http://www.math.sci.hiroshima-u.ac.jp/~m-mat/MT/ARTICLES/sfmt.pdf
00207    *
00208    * The template argument gives the type \e RandomType of the "natural"
00209    * result.  This incorporates the bit width and the C++ type of the result.
00210    * The 32-bit and 64-bit versions of SFMT19937 produce the same sequences and
00211    * the differing only in whether how the state is represented.  The
00212    * implementation includes a version using 128-bit SSE2 instructions.  On
00213    * machines without these instructions, portable implementations using
00214    * traditional operations are provided.  With the same starting seed,
00215    * SRandom32::Ran64() and SRandom64::Ran64() produces the same sequences.
00216    * Similarly SRandom64::Ran32() produces every other member of the sequence
00217    * produced by SRandom32::Ran32().
00218    *
00219    * The class chiefly supplies the method for advancing the state by
00220    * Transition.
00221    *
00222    * @tparam RandomType the type of the results, either Random_u32 or
00223    *   Random_u64.
00224    *
00225    * Written by Charles Karney <charles@karney.com> and licensed under the
00226    * MIT/X11 License.  For more information, see
00227    * http://randomlib.sourceforge.net/
00228    **********************************************************************/
00229   template<class RandomType> class RANDOM_EXPORT SFMT19937 {
00230   public:
00231     /**
00232      * The result RandomType
00233      **********************************************************************/
00234     typedef RandomType engine_t;
00235 #if defined(HAVE_SSE2) && HAVE_SSE2
00236     typedef __m128i internal_type;
00237 #elif defined(HAVE_ALTIVEC) && HAVE_ALTIVEC
00238     typedef vector unsigned internal_type;
00239 #else
00240     /**
00241      * The internal numeric type for SFMT19337::Transition
00242      **********************************************************************/
00243     typedef typename engine_t::type internal_type;
00244 #endif
00245   private:
00246     /**
00247      * The unsigned type of engine_t
00248      **********************************************************************/
00249     typedef typename engine_t::type engine_type;
00250     /**
00251      * The width of the engine_t
00252      **********************************************************************/
00253     static const unsigned width = engine_t::width;
00254     enum {
00255       /**
00256        * The Mersenne prime is 2<sup><i>P</i></sup> - 1
00257        **********************************************************************/
00258       P = 19937,
00259       /**
00260        * The long lag for SFMT19937 in units of 128-bit words
00261        **********************************************************************/
00262       N128 = (P + 128 - 1)/128,
00263       /**
00264        * How many width words per 128-bit word.
00265        **********************************************************************/
00266       R = 128 / width,
00267       /**
00268        * The short lag for SFMT19937  in units of 128-bit words
00269        **********************************************************************/
00270       M128 = 122,
00271       /**
00272        * The short lag for SFMT19937
00273        **********************************************************************/
00274       M = M128 * R
00275     };
00276 #if (defined(HAVE_SSE2) && HAVE_SSE2) || (defined(HAVE_ALTIVEC) && HAVE_ALTIVEC)
00277     static const Random_u32::type magic0 = 0x1fffefUL;
00278     static const Random_u32::type magic1 = 0x1ecb7fUL;
00279     static const Random_u32::type magic2 = 0x1affffUL;
00280     static const Random_u32::type magic3 = 0x1ffff6UL;
00281 #else
00282     /**
00283      * Magic matrix for SFMT19937.  Only the low 21 (= 32 - 11) bits need to be
00284      * set.  (11 is the right shift applied to the words before masking.
00285      **********************************************************************/
00286     static const engine_type
00287       magic0 = width == 32 ? 0x1fffefULL : 0x1ecb7f001fffefULL;
00288     static const engine_type
00289       magic1 = width == 32 ? 0x1ecb7fULL : 0x1ffff6001affffULL;
00290     static const engine_type
00291       magic2 = width == 32 ? 0x1affffULL :                0ULL;
00292     static const engine_type
00293       magic3 = width == 32 ? 0x1ffff6ULL :                0ULL;
00294 #endif
00295     /**
00296      * Mask for simulating u32 << 18 with 64-bit words
00297      **********************************************************************/
00298     static const engine_type mask18 = engine_type(0xfffc0000fffc0000ULL);
00299     /**
00300      * Magic constants needed by "period certification"
00301      **********************************************************************/
00302     static const engine_type PARITY0 = 1U;
00303     static const engine_type PARITY1 = width == 32 ? 0U : 0x13c9e68400000000ULL;
00304     static const engine_type PARITY2 = 0U;
00305     static const engine_type PARITY3 = width == 32 ? 0x13c9e684UL : 0U;
00306     /**
00307      * Least significant bit of PARITY
00308      **********************************************************************/
00309     static const unsigned PARITY_LSB = 0;
00310     static const engine_type mask = engine_t::mask;
00311 
00312   public:
00313     /**
00314      * A version number "EnSM" or "EnSN" to ensure safety of Save/Load.  This
00315      * needs to be unique across RandomAlgorithms.
00316      **********************************************************************/
00317     static const unsigned version = 0x456e534dUL + (engine_t::width/32 - 1);
00318     enum {
00319       /**
00320        * The size of the state.  The long lag for SFMT19937
00321        **********************************************************************/
00322       N = N128 * R
00323     };
00324     /**
00325      * Advance state by \e count batches.  For speed all \e N words of state
00326      * are advanced together.  If \e count is negative, the state is stepped
00327      * backwards. This is the meat of the SFMT19937 engine.
00328      *
00329      * @param[in] count how many batches to advance.
00330      * @param[in,out] statev the internal state of the random number generator.
00331      **********************************************************************/
00332     static void Transition(long long count, internal_type statev[])
00333       throw();
00334 
00335     /**
00336      * Manipulate a word of the state prior to output.  This is a no-op for
00337      * SFMT19937.
00338      *
00339      * @param[in] y a word of the state.
00340      * @return the result.
00341      **********************************************************************/
00342     static engine_type Generate(engine_type y) throw() { return y; }
00343 
00344     /**
00345      * Convert an arbitrary state into a legal one.  This consists a "period
00346      * certification to ensure that the period of the generator is at least
00347      * 2<sup><i>P</i></sup> - 1.
00348      *
00349      * @param[in,out] state the state of the generator.
00350      **********************************************************************/
00351     static void NormalizeState(engine_type state[]) throw();
00352 
00353     /**
00354      * Check that the state is legal, throwing an exception if it is not.  This
00355      * merely verifies that the state is not all zero.  At the same time,
00356      * accumulate a checksum of the state.
00357      *
00358      * @param[in] state the state of the generator.
00359      * @param[in,out] check an accumulated checksum.
00360      **********************************************************************/
00361     static void CheckState(const engine_type state[], Random_u32::type& check);
00362 
00363     /**
00364      * Return the name of the engine
00365      *
00366      * @return the name.
00367      **********************************************************************/
00368     static std::string Name() throw() {
00369       return "SFMT19937<Random_u" +
00370         std::string(width == 32 ? "32" : "64") + ">";
00371     }
00372   };
00373 
00374 } // namespace RandomLib
